# Character Races

![](../images/races.png)

## Demography

The allowed PC character races in Old School D&D are Human, Dwarf, Elf, Half-Elf, Halfling, Half-Orc, Gnome and Goblin.  

:::{#demography-table}
| **Race** | **% of Population** | **Extra Language(s)** |
|:--------:|:-------------------:|:---------------------:|
| Dwarf    | 10%                 | Dwarvish              |
| Elf      | 10%                 | Elvish, and Sylvan    |
| Gnome    | 5%                  | Gnomish               |
| Goblin   | 5%                  | Goblin                |
| Half-Elf | 5%                  | Elvish                |
| Half-Orc | 5%                  | Orchish               |
| Halfling | 10%                 | n/a                   |
| Human    | 50%                 | n/a                   |
:::
:::{.table-caption}
**Table:** Demographical Distribution
:::

```{ojs}
import { highlightTableRow, readMatrixFromTable } from "../custom.js"

Inputs.button(
  html`<button style="color:black;background-color:lightgray;">Roll Race</button>`,
  {
    value: "",
    reduce: () => {
      var matrix = readMatrixFromTable("#demography-table");

      // Weighted by percentage
      var weights = [
        { range: [1, 10], idx: 1 },  // Dwarf 10%
        { range: [11, 20], idx: 2 }, // Elf 10%
        { range: [21, 25], idx: 3 }, // Gnome 5%
        { range: [26, 30], idx: 4 }, // Goblin 5%
        { range: [31, 35], idx: 5 }, // Half-Elf 5%
        { range: [36, 40], idx: 6 }, // Half-Orc 5%
        { range: [41, 50], idx: 7 }, // Halfling 10%
        { range: [51, 100], idx: 8 } // Human 50%
      ];

      // Roll percentile
      var roll = Math.floor(Math.random() * 100) + 1;
      var entry = weights.find(w => roll >= w.range[0] && roll <= w.range[1]);
      var idx = entry.idx;

      highlightTableRow("#demography-table", idx);

      var row = matrix[idx - 1]; // [Race, %, Extra Language]
      return "You rolled " + roll + ": " + row[0] + " (" + row[1] + " of population). Extra Languages: " + (row[2] || "None");
    }
  }
)
```

## Dwarves

### Description
Brave, stalwart folk as sturdy as the stone kingdoms they carve inside mountains.

You know the Common and Dwarvish languages.

### Stout
Start with +2HP.  Roll HP per level with advantage

### Starting Age

| **Class**                  | **Starting Age** |
|----------------------------|------------------|
| Cleric                     | 250 + 2d10 years |
| Fighter                    | 40 + 5d4 years   |
| Magic-User                 | 125 + 2d10 years |
| Thief                      | 75 + 3d6 years   |


### Male Height & Weight

:::{#dwarf-male-height-weight-table}

| **d%** | **Description** | **Height**              | **Weight**              |
|--------|-----------------|-------------------------|-------------------------|
| 01–10  | Small           | 3 ft 9 in + 1d4 in      | 130 lbs + 1d20 lbs      |
| 11–25  | Slim            | 4 ft 1 in + 1d4 in      | 140 lbs + 1d20 lbs      |
| 26–55  | Normal          | 4 ft 2 in + 1d4 in      | 150 lbs + 1d20 lbs      |
| 56–85  | Stout           | 4 ft 2 in + 1d4 in      | 160 lbs + 1d20 lbs      |
| 86–95  | Tall            | 4 ft 6 in + 1d4 in      | 160 lbs + 1d20 lbs      |
| 96–00  | Outsize         | 4 ft 9 in + 1d4 in      | 170 lbs + 1d20 lbs      |

```{ojs}
import { generalTableSelect } from "../custom.js"

Inputs.button(
  html`<button style="color:black;background-color:lightgray;">Roll Height & Weight</button>`,
  {
    value: "",
    reduce: () => {
      const result = generalTableSelect([1,100,0], [
        [1,10],
        [11,25],
        [26,55],
        [56,85],
        [86,95],
        [96,100]
      ]);
      highlightTableRow("#dwarf-male-height-weight-table", result);
      return [
        "Small — 3 ft 9 in + 1d4 in / 130 lbs + 1d20 lbs",
        "Slim — 4 ft 1 in + 1d4 in / 140 lbs + 1d20 lbs",
        "Normal — 4 ft 2 in + 1d4 in / 150 lbs + 1d20 lbs",
        "Stout — 4 ft 2 in + 1d4 in / 160 lbs + 1d20 lbs",
        "Tall — 4 ft 6 in + 1d4 in / 160 lbs + 1d20 lbs",
        "Outsize — 4 ft 9 in + 1d4 in / 170 lbs + 1d20 lbs"
      ][result - 1];
    }
  }
)
```

## Gnomes

Curious, clever, and endlessly inventive folk who dwell in burrows and hidden workshops.  They delight in secrets, riddles, and tinkering with magic and mechanism alike.  

You know the Common and Gnomish languages.  

### Tinker
Once per day, you can create a minor magical or mechanical effect: a spark of light, a faint sound, or a tiny contraption that lasts a few minutes.
